questions.im_desp: The question has four options, each depicting a graph of Energy (E, K, U) versus distance from the center of the earth (r). Each graph has three curves labeled E, K, and U. Option (1): E is a horizontal line below zero, K is a curve starting high and decreasing towards zero, U is a curve starting below zero and increasing towards zero but staying negative. Option (2): E is a horizontal line below zero, K is a curve starting high and decreasing towards zero, U is a curve starting negative, increasing and becomes positive. Option (3): E is a horizontal line below zero, K is a curve starting low and increasing, U is a curve starting below zero and increasing towards zero but staying negative. Option (4): E is a horizontal line below zero, K is a curve starting low and increasing, U is a curve starting negative, increasing and becomes positive.

The plateau at 70°C indicates the melting point, and the final temperature reached is the boiling point.

Figure (ii) shows a logic circuit diagram consisting of a NAND gate followed by a NOT gate. Figures (iii) to (vi) show four different output waveforms, all square waves with different patterns of high and low levels. Figure (iii): Starts low, then high, then low, then high. questions.im_desp: The question has four options, each depicting a resonating structure for the molecule CH2=CH-CH=CH-O-CH3. Option (1): Structure with positive charge on oxygen and negative charge on CH2 carbon. Option (2): Structure with positive charge on oxygen and negative charge on the other CH2 carbon at the end of the conjugated system. Option (3): Structure with positive charge on carbon adjacent to oxygen and negative charge on CH2 carbon. Option (4): Structure with no charges, representing the canonical form.

questions.im_desp: The image displays a reaction scheme and four options, each depicting a possible product. The reaction starts with a cyclic ketone reacting with H₂O and OH⁻ to produce a product labeled 'Product'. Option (1): A cyclic structure with two hydroxyl groups (-OH) attached to adjacent carbons, indicating a diol. Option (2): A cyclic structure with a single hydroxyl group (-OH) and a ketone group (=O) still present. Option (3): A cyclic structure with a ring-opened chain, having a hydroxyl group (-OH) at one end and a carboxylic acid group (-COOH) at the other end. Option (4): A cyclic structure with a single hydroxyl group (-OH) and a methyl group (-CH3) attached to the ring.

questions.question: An organic compound (A) on reduction gives a compound (B) which on reaction with CHCl₃ and NaOH form (C). The compound (C) on catalytic reduction gives N-methylaniline. The compound (A) is :
Which of the following gives an optically inactive aldaric acid on oxidation with dilute HNO₃ acid ?
questions.im_desp: The question presents four options, each depicting a different aldaric acid structure. Aldaric acids are dicarboxylic acids formed by the oxidation of the aldehyde and primary alcohol groups of aldoses. Option (1): An aldaric acid structure with hydroxyl groups on carbons 2, 3, and 4 all on the right side (assuming Fischer projection). Option (2): An aldaric acid structure with hydroxyl groups on carbons 2 and 4 on the right, and carbon 3 on the left. Option (3): An aldaric acid structure with hydroxyl groups on carbons 2 and 3 on the right, and carbon 4 on the left. Option (4): An aldaric acid structure with hydroxyl groups on carbons 2 and 3 on the left, and carbon 4 on the right.

questions.im_desp: The image shows a reaction scheme and three product options. The reactant is a naphthalene ring system reacting with COCl2, AlCl3 and H2O. Option (1): A naphthalene ring with a carboxylic acid group (-COOH) attached at the 2-position. Option (2): A naphthalene ring with a ketone group (=O) forming part of a five-membered ring fused to the naphthalene system. Option (3): A naphthalene ring with a carboxylic acid group (-COOH) attached at the 1-position.

options.3: A- Equisetum, B-Salvinia, C- Selaginella, D-Fern

questions.im_desp: The image contains four figures labeled (A), (B), (C), and (D), each depicting a different plant or plant part. Figure (A) shows a plant with segmented stems and whorls of small leaves at the nodes, resembling Equisetum (horsetail). Figure (B) shows a leafy, branching plant, possibly Selaginella or a similar lycophyte. Figure (C) shows a fern frond with characteristic fiddleheads and pinnate leaves. Figure (D) shows a small, floating aquatic plant, possibly Salvinia.

questions.question: What type of human population is represented by the adjacent pyramid ?
questions.im_desp: The image shows a population pyramid. The pyramid has a wide base, gradually narrowing towards the top. The pre-reproductive age group at the base is the largest, followed by the reproductive and then post-reproductive age groups, which are progressively smaller. This shape is characteristic of an expanding population.
